snippet: A skilled center in the Quebec Provincial League, Herb Carnegie was denied an opportunity to become the N.H.L.’s first black player. He died Friday at 92.
abstract: Canadian ice hockey player Herb Carnegie, a skilled center in the Quebec Provincial League in the 1940s and 50s, was denied an opportunity to become the NHL’s first black player; he died on March 9 at age 92.
lead_paragraph: A skilled center in the Quebec Provincial League, Herb Carnegie was denied an opportunity to become the N.H.L.’s first black player. He died Friday at 92.

headline.seo: Herb Carnegie Dies; Trailblazer Never Got His N.H.L. Shot
headline.main: A Hockey Trailblazer Who Missed His Chance
headline.print_headline: A Hockey Trailblazer Who Missed His Chance
